column2: NORTH DAKOTA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a construction site.
column6: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column8: that you must not drive past this sign.
column10: that you must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 4. Drugs may interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely:
column6: even if they are prescribed by a doctor.
column8: unless they are prescribed by a doctor.

column2: 5. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: straight down the middle of the road.
column10: towards the left side of the road.

column2: 6. Speed limit signs are:
column8: destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 7. BAC is expressed in:
column8: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 8. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
column8: Distracted driving.

column2: 9. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 10. Regulatory signs are:
column8: Suggestions

column2: 11. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 12. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
column6: know that you should avoid this bad habit.
column8: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.

column2: 13. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column8: away from the curb.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Church ahead

column2: 15. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column10: means that you need to stop.

column2: 16. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: You must pass the school bus.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 17. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 18. To drive more safely at night:
column6: make sure your headlights are working properly.
column8: don’t drive when you are tired.

column2: 19. Do not pass:
column6: when school bus lights are flashing.
column8: when approaching intersections.

column2: 20. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.

column2: 21. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column8: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 23. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 24. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column8: green and white.

column2: 25. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
